block.p: Meredith Sara Bowne, a daughter of Nancee and Edward Bowne of Caldwell, N.J., was married yesterday to Paul E. Bove, a son of Susan Fainstein of New York and Roger Bove of West Chester, Pa. The Rev. Gordon H. Tremaine performed the ceremony at St. Peter's Episcopal Church in Essex Fells, N.J.

Mrs. Bove is a senior consultant in Alexandria, Va., for Xpedior, an e-business consulting firm. She graduated from Gettysburg College. Her father is the director of instruction for the Hillside (N.J.) public schools. Her mother is the director of St. Peter's Nursery School in Essex Fells.

Meredith Sara Bowne, a daughter of Nancee and Edward Bowne of Caldwell, N.J., was married yesterday to Paul E. Bove, a son of Susan Fainstein of New York and Roger Bove of West Chester, Pa. The Rev. Gordon H. Tremaine performed the ceremony at St. Peter's Episcopal Church in Essex Fells, N.J.

Mrs. Bove is a senior consultant in Alexandria, Va., for Xpedior, an e-business consulting firm. She graduated from Gettysburg College. Her father is the director of instruction for the Hillside (N.J.) public schools. Her mother is the director of St. Peter's Nursery School in Essex Fells.

Mr. Bove teaches history at Central High School in Capitol Heights, Md. He graduated from Hampshire College and received a master's degree in international affairs from George Washington University and another in education from American University.

The bridegroom's mother is a professor of urban planning and policy development at Rutgers University in New Brunswick. His father is a professor of economics at West Chester University. The bridegroom's stepmother, Patrice Bove, teaches music at Valley Forge Elementary School in Wayne, Pa. His stepfather, Norman Fainstein, is the dean of the faculty at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, N.Y.
